item.title: On minimal flat-injective presentations over local graded rings
item.description: arXiv:2410.17667v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Flat-injective presentations were introduced by Miller (2020) to provide combinatorial descriptions of $\mathbb Z^n$-graded modules. We consider them in the setting of local graded rings $R$, with grading over an abelian group, and give a criterion for minimality of them. In the special case of the polynomial ring, this criterion reduces to a family of $k$-linear equations, and we are able to give an algorithmic procedure for reduction. Furthermore, we provide the description of a flat-injective presentation, which can be constructed from the scalar multiplication maps of a given finitely generated $R$-module. Thereby, we solve the construction problem for flat-injective presentations under strong finiteness assumptions.
item.dc:creator: Fritz Grimpen, Anastasios Stefanou

item.title: Poincar\'e series of semigroups
item.description: arXiv:2410.17818v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Many invariants of affine semigroups can be studied from their Poincar\'e series, we offer and present several closed formulas for them. Moreover, these formulas have elementary proofs and are presented in two distinct families: one characterized by its topological nature and the other by its purely combinatorial approach.
item.dc:creator: Antonio Campillo, Raquel Melgar

item.title: Birational geometry of blowups via Weyl chamber decompositions and actions on curves
item.description: arXiv:2410.18008v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we study the birational geometry of $X$, a projective space $\mathbb{P}^n$ blown up at $s$ general points. We obtain a characterization of a special class of subvarieties, which we call Weyl $r$-planes, each of them being swept out by one $(n-r)$-moving curve class. For Mori dream spaces $X$, we unify different previous approaches, by reinterpreting the description of the Mori chamber decomposition of the effective cone in terms of these curve classes; in this case all relevant orbits are finite. For general $s$, we prove that Weyl $r$-planes are infinite and continue to appear as stable base locus. This yields the definition of the Weyl chamber decomposition of the pseudoeffective cone of divisors, that is a coarsening of its Mori chamber decomposition, when the latter can be defined. We prove that the combinatorics of such chamber decomposition obeys the Weyl group action on curves. We conjecture that for $s=n+4$ the Weyl and the Mori chamber decompositions coincide.
item.dc:creator: Maria Chiara Brambilla, Olivia Dumitrescu, Elisa Postinghel, Luis Jos\'e Santana S\'anchez

item.title: Standard monomials and invariant theory for arc spaces I: general linear group
item.description: arXiv:2108.06864v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: This is the first in a series of papers on standard monomial theory and invariant theory of arc spaces. For any algebraically closed field $K$, we construct a standard monomial basis for the arc space of the determinantal variety over $K$. As an application, we prove the arc space analogue of the first and second fundamental theorems of invariant theory for the general linear group.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Commun. Contemp. Math. 26 (2024), no.4, Paper No. 2350013, 38 pp
item.dc:creator: Andrew R. Linshaw, Bailin Song

item.title: A short resolution of the diagonal for smooth projective toric varieties of Picard rank 2
item.description: arXiv:2208.00562v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Given a smooth projective toric variety $X$ of Picard rank 2, we resolve the diagonal sheaf on $X \times X$ by a linear complex of length $\dim{X}$ consisting of finite direct sums of line bundles. As applications, we prove a new case of a conjecture of Berkesch-Erman-Smith that predicts a version of Hilbert's Syzygy Theorem for virtual resolutions, and we obtain a Horrocks-type splitting criterion for vector bundles over smooth projective toric varieties of Picard rank 2, extending a result of Eisenbud-Erman-Schreyer. We also apply our results to give a new proof, in the case of smooth projective toric varieties of Picard rank 2, of a conjecture of Orlov concerning the Rouquier dimension of derived categories.
item.dc:creator: Michael K. Brown, Mahrud Sayrafi

item.title: Differential Galois groups, specializations and Matzat's conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2209.01581v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We study families of linear differential equations parametrized by an algebraic variety $\mathcal{X}$ and show that the set of all points $x\in \mathcal{X}$, such that the differential Galois group at the generic fibre specializes to the differential Galois group at the fibre over $x$, is Zariski dense in $\mathcal{X}$. As an application, we prove Matzat's conjecture in full generality: The absolute differential Galois group of a one-variable function field over an algebraically closed field of characteristic zero is a free proalgebraic group.
item.dc:creator: Ruyong Feng, Michael Wibmer

item.title: Steiner representations of hypersurfaces
item.description: arXiv:2210.03408v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $X\subseteq{\mathbb P}^{n+1}$ be an integral hypersurface of degree $d$. We show that each locally Cohen-Macaulay instanton sheaf $\mathcal E$ on $X$ with respect to $\mathcal O_X\otimes\mathcal O_{\mathbb P^{n+1}}(1)$ in the sense of Definition 1.3 in arXiv:2205.04767 [math.AG] yields the existence of Steiner bundles $\mathcal G$ and $\mathcal F$ on $\mathbb P^{n+1}$ of the same rank $r$ and a morphism $\varphi\colon \mathcal G(-1)\to\mathcal F^\vee$ such that the form defining $X$ to the power $\mathrm{rk}(\mathcal E)$ is exactly $\det(\varphi)$. We inspect several examples for low values of $d$, $n$ and $\mathrm{rk}(\mathcal E)$. In particular, we show that the form defining a smooth integral surface in $\mathbb P^3$ is the pfaffian of some skew-symmetric morphism $\varphi\colon \mathcal F(-1)\to\mathcal F^\vee$, where $\mathcal F$ is a suitable Steiner bundle on $\mathbb P^3$ of sufficiently large even rank.
item.dc:creator: Vincenzo Antonelli, Gianfranco Casnati

item.title: The ring of differential operators on a monomial curve is a Hopf algebroid
item.description: arXiv:2405.08490v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: This article considers cuspidal curves whose coordinate rings are numerical semigroup algebras. Using a general result about descent of Hopf algebroid structures, their rings of differential operators are shown to be cocommutative and conilpotent left Hopf algebroids. If the semigroups are symmetric so that the curves are Gorenstein, they are full Hopf algebroids (admit an antipode).
item.dc:creator: Ulrich Kr\"ahmer, Myriam Mahaman

item.title: The chain algebra of a pure poset
item.description: arXiv:2410.05024v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We extend the chain algebra, originally defined in \cite{GN} for finite distributive lattices to that of finite pure posets. We show this algebra corresponds to the Ehrhart ring of a (0,1)-polytope, termed the chain polytope, and characterize the indecomposability of this polytope. Furthermore, we prove the normality of the chain algebra, describe its canonical module, and extend one of main results from \cite{GN} by computing its Krull dimension. For width-2 pure posets, we determine the algebra's regularity and conditions for it to be Gorenstein or nearly Gorenstein.
item.dc:creator: Dancheng Lu
